qas.question: What is the division of Catalan dialects?
What is the basic difference between the dialects?
What is the differenctiation between Catalan and Valencian?
What are Catalan and Valencian assumed to be?
What are Catalan and Valencian considered to be in the language?

context: Catalan dialects are relatively uniform, and are mutually intelligible. They are divided into two blocks, <a0_0>Eastern and Western<a0_0/>, differing mostly in <a1_0>pronunciation<a1_0/>. The terms "Catalan" and "Valencian" (respectively used in Catalonia and the Valencian Community) are two <a2_0>different varieties<a2_0/> of <a3_0>the same language<a3_0/>. There are two institutions regulating the <a4_0>two standard varieties<a4_0/>, the Institute of Catalan Studies in Catalonia and the Valencian Academy of the Language in Valencia.
